title: BR Properties scoops up Sao Paulo towers for 766m reais
text:
[RIO DE JANEIRO] Brazil's BR Properties SA has agreed to buy part of a large mixed-use development in Sao Paulo for 766 million reais (S$254.5 million), it said on Monday, underlining the recovery of Latin America's largest corporate real estate market.

In a securities filing, the firm said it was purchasing one full tower in the Parque da Cidade complex and 30 per cent of another tower, both owned by real estate investment firm Hemisferio Sul Investimentos.

The purchase will be formalised upon the completion of the towers, both of which are under construction. The Parque de Cidade complex, located in an affluent business district in southern Sao Paulo, includes residential and office space, as well as a shopping mall and an upscale hotel.

In recent years, several real estate firms have been hunting acquisitions in the region as vacancy rates come down following a prolonged recession.

REUTERS
description: : THE BUSINESS TIMES Real Estate - [RIO DE JANEIRO] Brazil's BR Properties SA has agreed to buy part of a large mixed-use development in Sao Paulo for 766 million reais (S$254.5 million), it said on Monday, underlining the recovery of Latin America's largest corporate real estate market. . Read more at The Business Times.
